Recommended Treatment: Per NCCN guidelines for stage IB, grade 3 endometrioid carcinoma: adjuvant chemotherapy with carboplatin and paclitaxel combined with vaginal brachytherapy, with consideration of pelvic external beam radiation therapy.
Description: Surgical pathology reveals a high-grade endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the uterine corpus with malignant squamous differentiation, >50% myometrial invasion, FIGO stage IB (pT1bN0), and no lymph node metastases.
Patient Notes: Your report shows a high-grade cancer in the lining of your uterus that invaded more than half of the muscle layer but did not spread to any lymph nodes. The standard recommendation after surgery is a combination of chemotherapy (carboplatin and paclitaxel) and targeted radiation delivered inside the vagina, with possible external radiation. This treatment approach helps reduce the chance of the cancer returning. Your oncology team will explain the plan and support you throughout therapy.

verification.assessment: Extracted information is accurate, complete, and consistent with the source report and relevant NCCN guidelines.
